intro: Luvunga subanenianae, commonly known as the Subanenian luvunga, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from deep red to orange. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within montane forests. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a glossy surface, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
